Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 04:54AM CJNov04 wrote: This is CJ from METAvivor.  Thank you so much, English Major, for posting highlights from my article: "Trying to Stay Alive on Two Percent".  I wanted to clarify our use of funds.  100% of every research-designated donation and all proceeds from research-designated fundraisers go into our MBC research grant.  A minimum of 90% all other donations/fundraiser funds also go into our MBC research grant.  At the end of each year, any excess funds in our operating account go into our MBC research grant account.  We are all volunteers working largely out of our homes and paying much out of pocket.  Our 2-day/week office is "rented" for a token $1/year. A young mets researcher pays for our website ... etc.  We truly operate on a minimum.  We were therefore shocked when our first year's finances showed 17% in Admin costs.  This was due to hefty fees for applying for non-profit status + state charity status + trademark fees + corporation filing fees + insurance to cover our fundraisers,etc.  These basic fees are the same for everyone and if you do not bring in much money, like many new charities, then the percentage of your income going into these mandatory expenses is going to be high.  As to how some organizations boast 0% or only 2-3%, now that I have my own non-profit I don't understand how anyone can do this unless they have been set up by an organization that is paying 100% of their expenses ... and then my questions are:  Who? And what are they getting out of it?   But I wish to leave you with our sincere promise that we put 100% of every research-designated donation received into our MBC research grant ... we promise that to our donors and we make good on that promise.    I wish you all the very best.  CJ (Dian M. Corneliussen-James - DX: BC mets to lung in 2006), President, METAvivor (www.metavivor.org)  Visit our Facebook Page. (Note:  Our Facebook  "group" is no longer active.  Please seek our Facebook "page".)

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2012 11:17PM CJNov04 wrote: It has been about 1.5 years since the last post ... but I just saw this and wanted to comment.  I am co-founder and President of METAvivor .  Our first grant was awarded in January 2010 to Danny R. Welch, Ph.D.  We initially intended to award our second grant in January 2011.  We ran a little behind in raising the funds at that point, but quickly caught up and did indeed award not only one grant but two grants that year.  They were awarded Oct 2011 to Alana Welm, Ph.D. and Andrea Mastro, Ph.D.  This year we are well on track to award even more grant funding.  Our request for research grant proposals for 2012 is now out.  We are very confident we will continue to award annual research grants well into the future and that the amount of grant money will increase annually.  I would  like to clarify that 100% of every donation (minus 2.3% in PayPal fees when applicable) and 100% of all fundraiser proceeds after expenses, go into our research grants.  We are a 100% volunteer organization and our expenses are paid from store sales and grants we receive that are specified for such use only.
